title: Caitlyn went from a troll pick to “she needs nerf” without a single buff
body:
With the only buff she got being Twitch and Tristana nerfs.

I’ve just seen a “are adcs really so op” post on the frontpage and I decided to answer with this thread, no hate towards Caitlyn because I don’t really mind her being strong over stuff like Tristana. Short answer: yes, as long as crit itemization is grossly underpriced AD carries will be strong. 

Both Caitlyn and Ezreal are back to 22%+ playrate despite getting zero direct buffs.
This should also make Riot think about how botlane is balanced. Nerf an adc = another one rises to crowd out diversity in the botlane, and then nerf again, meta shifts again, in an endless cycle. 

The fact that ADCs are balanced in relation to each other could be an advantage though: instead of buffing the weak ones, why can’t you nerf the broken ones? 
It’s a win/win situation: lower the overall damage in the game and make botlane healthier, two things the community has been asking for forever.

I think this just goes to show how isolated balance really is in bot lane, and how misleading stats can be when viewed without context. In this particular case, the only reason many marksmen don't have massively higher win and play rates is because there are a handful of other marksmen who just so happen to be even more powerful. Because competition among marksmen still just boils down to who is statistically the most powerful, rather than who contributes a particular strength, it becomes this winner-takes-all situation where whichever two strongest marksmen get all the attention, and everyone else becomes comparatively much less relevant, even if they're still super-strong in their own right. De-isolating bot lane by introducing more classes, and making a bigger effort to diversify the marksman class, could go a long way towards painting a truer picture of the state of balance in bot lane, and preventing such balance islands from occurring in the future.
